result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Boos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Kurt B. Zengler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody. Cases called appearances given.  Victim rights are complied with Victims are not present.  State informs the court that the parties are stipulating to the reports of the doctors.  Defense attorney addresses the court. They have reviewed the report and the doctor report states that the deft is competent to proceed with the cases.  Court addresses the parties and will resume with the cases.  Defense would like to schedule and plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No contact with the victim or their residence.  No contact with the witness or their residence.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

01:48 PM - case called.  Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach, specially, via Zoom.  Andrew R Polzin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James E. Boos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - plea of not guilty - competency has been raised.  Court accepts not guilty pleas.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Atty Fehrenbach.  Court sets bond.  Court orders a competency evaluation and further transfers this matter to Branch 1 under local court rule.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
